review: Sorry don't get the bad reviews... Nice place. Good people. Clean Food delivered quickly.  Beer was cold.  People reviewing must be dicks.

Food is pre cooked then frozen and shipped to Chili's.  Reheated then served and it tasted it.  Good service at this location, clean and friendly.  Best just for drinks because the food taste like TV dinners.

We visit this restaurant on the way home from Vegas.  It was a great because it was next to the Tesla charging station, so we did not need to walk a far distance and was able to charge the Tesla at the same time.  I came inside first, it was pretty empty, I can only see one staff at the bar. I did not know if I seat myself or wait for someone. There were no signs or staff around. I walked to the bar and finally got the attention of the bartender. She said for me to wait and someone will seat me.  So I walked back by the podium and waited for the waitress to sit me. There are no hostess at this restaraunt. I sat down, and had my drinks ordered. The waitress was nice and sweet.  She took our order and then someone else brought out the food. People were going in and out. The restaraunt was empty and not full to capacity.  The food: I order the asparagus for appetizers and they were delicious. It was fried but it should not have been too fried because the esparagus was overcooked.  I received my Santa Fe salads and it was excellent. I really like the salad here. It was delicious.  My friend ordered me a Watermelon drink, it had vodka in it, but not too much ice. It was delicious as well.  When I was eating, I begin people come in and start seating themselves, they did not wait. I think this restaraunt needs to be more clearer about seating procedures instead of making me or other people chasing around a staff.

Came here for a pit stop. Very impressed! Fast service, our waitress was very nice and attentive. She checked in on us often and made sure we had everything. Food came pretty quick and was really great. Definitely gave me a food coma though for the rest of the ride to Vegas. I'd like to stop by here again the next time I'm traveling.

Pat was our server... she was outstanding!  She was graceful and was killing it in the floor all by herself. We were blown away with her work ethic.  Came on our way back from our road trip to charge and decided on a bite to eat with so many choices to choose from we  we choose Chili's.  And because of her we will be returning to this Chilis!  The food was so good. Thanks Pat for your great customer service!

Driving LA to Vegas we needed a pit stop, a charge, as well as a relatively quick meal. Chili's shares the parking lot with the Tesla charger, so it's an ideal spot for a 30 minutes snack. This is a fairly typical Chili's restaurant. The decorating is unexciting, but it is neat and clean. Our server, Kara, was at our table almost immediately after we sat down with a big welcoming smile and answers to the questions we had about the menu. We started with the California grilled chicken flatbread. Boy was that great!! In addition to the grilled chicken, it had smoked bacon, tomato sauce, monterey jack and mozzarella cheese, and avocado. It was drizzled with roasted garlic aioli. A little spicy but not too much. Great way to start the meal. And it came out relatively fast so there was no delay and getting back on the road. We also shared the fajitas. We got it with chicken and shrimp. Next time I will get double shrimp and leave out the chicken. Another really good dish. I will definitely plan to stop here again on my next LA to Vegas trip.

I have not eaten at a Chilis in over a year because of the consistently bad service I have received. Came here today because it's what the group voted on. Loved the updated menu and choices but the experience was taken to another level due to our waitress Benji. She was so pleasant and attentive. Because of today I am going to give my local Chilis another try.  Food Lighter side menu sirloin and roasted avocado and tomatoes - perfectly cooked and pretty big for the price  Santa Fe salad with grilled chicken - the spice was of the chicken was very flavorful Avacado chicken bacon sandwich - amazing!!!

Disappointed today. Walked in behind a couple. No greeting. Not even a "We'll be right with you." Couple waited about 5 mins.. then left. We waited another 10 - still no greeting - finally we were approached and advised  that the wait was going to be 15 minutes. We left.  CUSTOMER SERVICE 101 - at least greet your customer and act like you're happy we chose to come to your establishment. No waitress, server, bartender greeted. They all saw us. I enjoy your food .. but not the service.
Pretty good food and pricing. Service is great. Watch TV while you eat.

Friendly and fast service from Benji today. She was efficient and very welcoming. My husband had the Caribbean Salad with shrimp. It was colorful, fresh, and tasty. It looked so good, I'll probably have it with chicken next time  we come. I had a side of broccoli which was slightly crisp, not over cooked at all. We shared guacamole. I ate most of the guacamole which was yummy. The salsa was tasty too. The chips were average chips. We will definitely be back when we are in Barstow next. Another plus, it's super close to the Tesla charging station. And lastly, I used the restroom while I was there and one of the employees wearing a hairnet was in the restroom at the same time. She washed her hands thoroughly with soap and then used her paper towel to turn off the water and open the door. Loved seeing great hygiene from someone who is probably preparing my food!

Not that they care about reviews, I'll add my experience anyways. We stopped in as usual while our Tesla charges. We come here about 4-6 times a month on our way to and from Vegas. We always sit in the bar and have had always had great service. But today, today we had Cindy.  We got our order in, chips and guacamole came out right away (unfortunately the avocados were not ripe and my attempt at mashing them was not making them into guac). To top it off, they left the skin from the seed in there.  We finished our drinks after about 15/20 min of sitting there never to have our waitress return to offer a refill.  About an hour later the food comes out. Mind you, the salad I asked for, for them to bring out BEFORE the meal, never came!  The expediter asked if we needed extra plates to which we replied "yes!". And she NEVER returned.  Waited about 10 minutes and then asked for a manager.  The server we asked, returned and said the manager was coming right out. Another 8 minutes passes, still no manager. Oh, but good ol' Cindy has shown back up now and ready to fill our drinks. How thoughtful! When we explained the above to her, she just smiled and said "ok, have a good day". No apologies, no excuses...just a passive aggressive response with a smile to boot! Not only was the customer service piss poor, but you'd expect as a regular, you'd get some attention when something goes wrong.  Over an hour here, no drink refills, pathetic guac, and so pissed that no manager ever showed up- we left without eating.  The only thing this place has going for it is that it's conveniently located next to the Tesla Supercharger.

Terrible! Waited & waited for burgers well done, they were almost raw. Manager lied & told us it would take 3 to 5 minutes, 25 minutes later we're still waiting!! Ridiculous! Have to put up with Old football crap on the TV's. Never coming here again!

I have to say I've had a couple of bad experiences with other Chili's locations. This time, however, our waitress was attentive and the service was excellent. I had the unlimited soup, salad and chips and she was quick to give me my soup and the chili was pretty good and not too salty like the other places. So I definitely recommend this place.
People skills are a must when it comes to waitressing. Very sarcastic and rude. I did not appreciate the sarcastic answers or the attitude.
Love coming to our local Chilis... the food is always great and the staff courteous and friendly yet professional.
Very clean great service, chips were fresh and hot nice blackberry margarita to start the meal and didn't have to wait long for a table at dinner time!!
Great service and quality food! It's always a pleasure to eat here when visiting family in Barstow.
Our first visit to a Chili's in 15 years. Our server was awesome. Mark (marco?) Our order was wonderful. Food service was great. Lots of choices. If there was a location near our home, we'd go.

This place was an a great place for me to drink cold beers and visit with the local folks while on travel. The bartenders were very nice and they had a great selection of beer. The place was clean and the music decent. Maybe I'm an easy to please, but I had no problem revisiting this Chilis over and over. A fun staff to.
The food is always great! Wings were hot and cane out fast. Our server was fantastic and kept our cups full. Everything was delish!
Understaffed. Poor service. Food came in waves so first round got cold. Bad choice this time.
This is for the most recent visit on a trip to Vegas.  The service was surprisingly good and they also changed the menus and everything is clean and food was great!
Time for a late lunch with my Bride & Timmy.  Service was amazing. Food was even better. It arrived fast, hot & tasty.  We will be back soon.

I normally go the the one in Victorville but I have been to this one twice. Every single time that I go to this one the service wasn't the best. They would forget I was sitting there. They rarely checked if we needed refills, anything else to eat, or if we were done. Mind you, it wasn't busy at all the two times that I did decide to go. The food was still pretty good, and we got a free potato soup so that's why they get three stars.

2 birds one stone. This was right next to the superchargers. Charge the car. And get some thing to eat      They had a really good deal 3 for me for $10. Salad or chips burger and desert. Is that a miss print. No. Food was great service was excellent.  Would come back again.

My wife and I were in Barstow and were very hungry.  Very accommodating! I recommend the fajitas.  I had chicken fajitas and my wife had shrimp.  The lady working the bar great customer service.  I thought the chips were to salty she said no problem I will remake them.  Franchises usually do not have good customer service, I was impressed.

Our waitress Marcos was so helpful I'd give him a 11+ out of 10 very friendly even helped suggest a drink for me and it hit the spot my husband and I had a great time food was good the chicken on our plate was cold but they fixed it for us I would definitely be back

Was debating between the black bear diner and chillis. Chillis was open 30 minutes longer so we went there. Chillis is consistent and one of our favorites in any town. A little disappointed tonight. Service was slow and food was cold. I am going to let it slide because it is was the end of the night, but next time we will try Black bear diner.

What an huge disappointment. Bad service, even worse food. I cannot understand a franchisee spending a large amount of money to build a restaurant and then provide the worst service, and even worse food to customers.The location will fail.
Love there Wednesday ribs very nice and clean environment very caring waitresses and Waiters

It's a hit and miss with chili's.  Ordered the Buffalo crisper and the chicken & waffles to go tonight. Definitely a miss tonight,thought maybe the food would be made to order. Crispers were old, like they sat under a warming light most of the night and hardly any sauce. Such a disappointment! Was expecting better quality with our food,since we have limited choices in town!

We come here often and almost always sit at a table in the bar area. Our most recent trip was especially great. Marco was our waiter and he was awesome. He was attentive without being overly friendly. My bunless burger was delicious as was my skinny margarita. I love the kiosks on the table that let you pay whenever you're ready. There are a lot of negative reviews on here and in the past I would have agreed that service and food sucked but they have really improved over the last 6 months especially.

It's been a while since I dined at Chili's and I noticed it's changed a bit. The decor is trendier and now they have these kiosk tablets at all the tables where you are able to order food, check your Chili's account, play games, and pay for the food. I hate this little kiosk thing because it's so impersonal. We were able to order our food with the server but that's pretty much the only time we saw him. We had a difficult time catching the staff's attention to remove the massive amount of empty cups and dishes pilling up from our table. And when it came time to pay, you slide your cc through the kiosk and walk out. There's no need to wait for the check and the servers also don't bother to say goodbye either. But perhaps the detached service is exclusive to this one visit.  The Food: Nachos: Yes! I love how they put the cheese and toppings on each chip individually. This makes for a perfect and consistent bite.  Boneless Buffalo Chicken: No. Too vinegary and slightly dry.  Salmon: Delicious, highly recommended. Surprisingly very good.  Taco, enchilada, and tostada: Sorry, didn't do it for me. Flavors were all off. Overall, I'd try Chili's again because this could have been a fluke.

Service was at a snail's pace, and the "loaded" fajita was so skimpy, we had to laugh!  Nothing like the menu photo.  It was Lilliputian, and the dish was half empty.  What's cheaper than onion & bell pepper?  The condiment dish was likewise skimpy -- 2 teaspoons of salsa maybe.  Beans and rice were MIA, we had to ask, then ate them for desert.  The La Niña margarita was excellent, but no one ever asked if we'd like a 2nd.  Server kept telling us it was "crazy" busy, but half the tables were empty.  If not a good meal, we had a good laugh!

We had excellent service! All of our food was hot, our drinks were great, and we sat and hung out for 2 hours and were more than welcome. I appreciate this because most chilis aren't this way anymore. I had the grilled chicken burrito and my husband had the tacos. We have always shunned the new Tex mex menu, and to our suprise, it was great, we loved it.
Great food, quick service, fresh ingredients, next to  Tesla supercharger, highly recommended.
I'll be brief Service was a little slow Food was bland Generic feel to the place And no excuse for dirty silverware Meh

I have to give this 1 star, even though the menu looked a lot better than before.  I was excited to try a turkey burger with homemade pickles.  The server even had the burger split between my wife and myself( we shared).  I'm glad it was split, because it was much easier to see that it was PINK inside.  Also, water or some other type of liquid was spilling out of it.  When I called the server over, he took it in the back to look at it closer.  he came back and said he wasnt sure if it was under cooked, but they would remake.  That took over 30 min.  I asked 2 more times and finally called a manager over.  She came back, apologized and said she would remove it from the bill.  We had a coupon for a free appetizer so we paid nothing for dinner, but thats about what it was worth.  NOTHING.  We still left the server a tip, even though he didnt keep us in the loop.    Btw, we only ate here because it was superclose to our hotel.  Came at 6:15pm on a Friday night, was seated right away and didnt get out of there until 7:45.  An hour and a half I'll never be able to get back.   Shoulda went to Lola's Kitchen.

The last couple of times we ate here the service was very slow & when the food arrived it was tepid. I hate to send it back because we've already waited at least 30 minutes for it. The booths are also extraordinarily uncomfortable with one side or the other far away from the table. I want comfort after a long day of travel. I give it 2 stars because sometimes the food does taste good though my husband has had a tasteless burger.  I would eat at another Chili's but I'll go across the street to IHOP when we go through here in the future.

Its not our first choice to eat dinner ... its just walking distance from our Hotel basically in the same parking lot.  I am not really excited as we don't really have good experience with Chilis but hubby said if we drive we will loose our parking space so... its either, Dennys, Fat Burger, Carls Junior or Panda Express.  I am glad we pick Chilis... I enjoyed my half rack baby back ribs with fries and salad, hubby got a bacon cheese Burger with fries.  I am happy... we left Chilis very full and satisfied.  Its should been 5 stars if our server is more there when we need him but we understand we saw him very busy.  Thank you!

went for a birthday dinner and the waitress was rude and unprofessional gave a attitude to my family members and was very sarcastic with our questions about our food , and also we found a hair on our food as well

I am not surprised that the rating at this location is sooooo low!!! Someone needs to sit down with the management and let them know that just because they are the only decent (chain) sit down restaurant in the area that their service should be less than any other location. Seriously.  The last time we were there I had to get up to refill my own water and my boyfriends TWICE!!! TWO TIMES!!! That is shameful.  We have sent back food for being cold, been forgotten about at our table by the waitress (to the point where our order wasn't wen submitted to the kitchen--- we left on that occasion) and have had variations of less than acceptable service and quality of food on MANY, MANY OCCASIONS.  Unless you are forced to come here because  there is NO OTHER HIGHLY RECOGNIZABLE RESTAURANT IN THE AREA save your money and mental energy... It's not worth either.

Horrible service.  Waited forever to be asked if we wanted drinks (much less food) despite telling them several times no one had served us.  Food was slow to come and it took forever for the check.  Do yourself a favor and if you need a quick bite go somewhere else.

This place was well below your average Chili's.....The only reason why I am giving it two stars was because after 15 minutes of being seated, the busboy came and asked if we were helped and ended up going out of his way to take our order.  When we first arrived, the hostess said it would be a 30 minute wait, however after quickly looking around, you could see at least 6 tables not cleared off and open. We ended up only getting a drink and app and then leaving. I felt bad for leaving a bad tip but the truth is, the service was not at all what is expected.

Wow - most of the reviews of this place are pretty negative with bad service seeming to be the biggest complaint.  I gotta admit that the appeal of Chili's to me is probably  based on my college days, but there are days that I miss this food, especially since there are no locations close to the Pasadena area.  The chance to eat at Chili's on my way to Vegas seemed so appealing that I just had to do it. Mrs. C clearly ordered the best, with her pick 3 appetizers out of 8 or 9 items  I liked everything on her plate & should have ordered that.  I got the crispy chicken tacos with rice & beans which were ok, but pretty similar to something that I could have made at home with frozen chicken strips in a toaster oven & some tortillas.  However, the roasted corn guacamole was a huge serving & *excellent*.  Definitely getting this the next time I'm at a Chili's. I'd say that the service was a tad slow, but nothing like what the other Yelpers experienced.  Maybe corporate is paying attention to the reviews & put in some additional training or managers.  A competent meal gets 3 stars to hopefully balance out all of the problems that seem to be fixed.

I came today around lunch time for a quick bite as I was driving through town.  We sat in the bar area, and I couldn't help but notice the hostess, Kristen, working so hard. She came to our table more frequently than the server even did. She was going above and beyond, and I thought to myself, why isn't SHE our server? She was so helpful! She even held the door open for us as we were leaving. Excellent customer service skills! Keep it up!  We ordered wings and fajitas and they were really good!
Pathetic absolutely pathetic. Isn't even worth a chance. Bad customer service and apparently bad food. Highly recommend going to Dennys, or anywhere else.

WORST CHILI'S EVER!! Go to Mc Donald's!! Our food was SO over salted (and I like salt!) we had to wipe off the chips and  sent back our broccoli, asparagus, and fries. We requested them with out salt. My broccoli came back... good. Fries... good. Asparagus came back and they had WIPED OFF some of the salt. I know this because there was salt UNDERNEATH on one side of all my vegetable!! The manager said in order for them to not have salt (get this) they would have to WASH THE PAN!! ARE YOU KIDDING ME!?! WASH THE PAN!!  And no offer to substitute for another item!! And that was a load of b******* because, um duh, there was salt only on one side and the asparagus was overcooked on both sides!! Lady, you are seriously ignorant and a HORRIBLE MANAGER WITH NO INTEGRITY!!! The One star goes to the waitress MAVIS (not the restaurant) She was super sweet and didn't treat us any different after our dissatisfaction. So fire that manager and promote the waitress!! But whatever you do, DON'T EAT HERE!!!

Stuck in Barstow for work, two week stretches. This place is within walking distance of the hotel, so that's where I've been eating for an entire week now.  Staff:  mediocre. Michelle is awesome, but nobody else really takes the time to pay attention to you as a customer. If you've used their table side "ziosk" system to pay prior to your meal, forget amenities such as refills:  they already got their cash, and could not care less about you as a customer. Think that changes if they're empty?  Think again. I've walked out three days this week after the most bare bones service you could get from a sit down restaurant .  Food:  decent, depending on what you order. Made the mistake of ordering a steak the first day, and asked for it medium rare. It was served so grossly overdone and dry that old leather could be considered more tender. Started hitting the "lite mex" menu, and it's fairly decent. The chicken is a low quality but it's juicy and tender. The salmon has a decent flavor if you tell them not to cover it in their sugary sauces. The salads are crispy-ish, and the southwest chicken soup is yummy.  Overall, this place most likely stays open out of a combination monopoly in the area and all the outlet mall busses that saturates the area daily. Guess you don't need to worry about "great", or even "good" when you own the market.    But, it does beat Mc D's...

One word for the food: salty. Drinks were decent though, I tried the watermelon margarita and blueberry margarita and they were both pretty yummy.  For food I ordered the shrimp tacos...which was probably a bad idea in the first place because I usually never order anything fish related from a place that isn't close to a body of water or known for seafood. But either way it wasn't so great. The sauce they used was sweet and the tacos were salty in general. The guacamole was also too salty. Also tried some of the steak and it wasn't so great (salty again).  Probably won't be back here for dinner unless it just for the drinks!

We stopped in for take out on our way back from Cal yesterday.  It was a last minute decision to go to Chili's so we didn't call our order in ahead, big mistake.  We walk in to the take out area & were asked by one of the servers if we had placed our order yet and we said no we didn't get a chance to but we would just order now.  The server said someone would be right w/ us so we waited...and waited...and no one came by to take our order.  I figured it would just be easier if I hopped online and just placed our order using my phone.  So we waited for approximately 25 mins for our order to be ready and my husband goes back in to get our food.  Once again, one of the server tells my husband someone will be right w/ you, this time w/ an added "hun" which is so freaking annoying.  My husband waits another 10 mins and no one comes by to help him.  He tries asking two different servers about our order which he literally saw waiting & bagged up on their counter but gets ignored, so frustrating.  After another 5 or 10 mins someone finally comes by and gets our order to us.  My husband lets the server know how long he had been waiting but the server says he didn't see my husband standing there???  When we finally get a chance to eat our fajitas which was about 3 hours later when we made it home, the grilled steak fajitas was entirely inedible as one portion was literally way too undercooked and the other portion was way too grisly to chew!!!!  I cannot tell you how incredibly annoyed I was last night.  Do yourself a favor and eat elsewhere, this establishment is terrible.  I should've looked at the other yelp reviews before coming here, go figure 2 stars.

Everything was great! I had the smoked wings and we shared a fajita trio. Steak was super tasty, shrimp as well, they bring you tortillas and rice and beans! Great meal- Darlene was a great server.we will be back!

Had dinner here tonight. We chose open seating in the bar because it was packed and people were waiting.  I ordered a beer and a double shot. She said there was a 1 drink max per person. So she said she would bring a single shot with my beer. This was still breaking the rules, but she felt she could get away with it.  She came back with our drinks, and that single shot turned into a quad shot(4 If you do not embrace math terms). I am not complaining mind you...especially after the 2nd round. I was only charged $8.39 a glass for these quad shots. This was dirt cheap. Fiance had a blackberry margarita which was ok?  On to the food. I had the classic bacon burger. It was filling, but tasted sweet. That's weird. Fiance had an Old Timer burger which was greasy, but otherwise ok.  As with most chillis, they are busy and far between.

This review is based on the high class customer service I received while sitting at the bar. My servers Pat and Crystal are an amazing A+ team. They got to know everyone at the bar and made sure you were treated with the up-most care. My drinks were always filled and my food order done right to my liking. During my business stay in Barstow I will be dining here every night just to see both of them! Thank you Pat and Crystal.
Service was great and we enjoyed happy hour presidential margaritas. The special of $10 dollar dinners was a good deal

The service was horrible! so slow! Took ten minutes for someone to even ask us our drink order. As you can see from the pictures, the food is microwaved, cheeses are hard and chicken overlooked. The guac is supposed to be "homemade" but it's most obviously store bought and salted. The best part is they provide iPad type things on the table for the kids and then don't bother to tell you that they will add $1.99 to your bill!!! I asked to have it removed and it took fifteen mins for them to figure it out.

I usually only go for the dessert ! Chocolate Multon cake to be exact  it's so delicious ! But other then that the food isn't to great ! Other people I go with enjoy there food but it's just not for me .... The atmosphere and the bar is always great! I gave 4 stars because other people I go with don't complain but it's just not for me lol

I love Chili's!  But our server last night was the worst.  Never came to refill our drinks, our steak order was wrong, daughter's burger had onions when she said no onions.  Food was just ok.  For a $50 plus meal we should have got better service.  Not going back!

Love the servers! Especially Cindy, Marco, Alyssa T, Pat, Darlene and Shelby are always our go to! Sad Jerrid no longer works there. He is my favorite. Great food! Awesome service! Not sure why the bad reviews! Our group always enjoys everything about this chilis over every other chilis!

This place has poor customer service.  We had 2 servers assigned to us and no one helped us at all.  Another table sat down 10 minutes after us and server took care of them after waiting 15 minutes already.  We walked out.  What a joke.  This is why there isn't a wait.  If there was a rate of zero stars would be the one I would pick.  Save yourself a headache and walk across to Dennys, much better service and food is yummy.

Upon entering the restaurant, the hostess was far too timid for her job. I couldn't hear a single thing she said. I had to read her lips. Never was told how long the wait was. Went to the ladies and counted the empty tables on the dining room side. 20+ empty tables. 3 parties ahead of us were waiting. None larger than 5. 15 minutes later, one irate group finally spoke to a manager who was less than interested. We got seated shortly after that. We ordered 1/2 rack with fries, chili and a salad, and the appetizer trio. It took 30 minutes to get our food and it was Less than spectacular. Warm enough to pass, but cool enough to be irritating. This was not the fault of the server, as she was very friendly and prompt.

I wanted something other than a burger so we stopped at Chili's for some good grub. I had the fajita combo (shrimp and carnitas).  For the most part I enjoyed my meal.  The chips and salsa was great as usual and the refillable drinks we thirst quenching.  My wife on the other hand didn't enjoy her cheese enchilada plate and had to send it back two times and when the third plate finally came to the table, she was full from the chips and salsa.  I did like the tablets at the table though.  Way to use technology Chili's!  Updated menu and drinks were well received.

The service was extremely slow. You could make a case that they "ran out the clock" on us. From 9:00 PM to 10:45 PM I was able to get two beers, cheese curds and a burrito. The apologies were unsolicited and sincere but the service was still pretty slow. Oh and the mash potatoes appeared to have melted and cooled before the food was served. It had the consistency of a hockey puck. My friend's steak was reportedly dry. The beer was cold though.

Was happy to see they had Tower IPA from Karl Strauss. Ya don't see that very often. I just had to Triple Dipper sampler with boneless buffalo wings, Southwestern Egg Rolls and the seasoned onion rings. Everything was perfect for a late afternoon snack. Great job.

Chili's is probably not the best place in town to eat... when you're in a big city. But if you find yourself on highway 15 and need a reliable fix, Chili's! Thank you for being right there by the Barstow outlets! Got the veggie tacos and some dry-rub baby back ribs. Do come here for the baby back ribs if nothing else. Prices are very reasonable. More options than your usual fast food run when you're on your way to Vegas.
This place needs new management! It took 45 minutes for food to come out. If it was super busy I might understand. ....

Busy place but we were seated right away which was good. My husband and I had the Steak n Shrimp Fajita's which was very delicious. The waitress was very attentive and kept our drinks refilled which I thought happened to be pretty darn good considering how busy they were.

It's next to the Arco gas station and across from the Country Inn & Suites hotel.  There's a coupon at the Tangers Outlet coupon booklet for a free chips and salsa. It's very spacious at the dining area and the bar.  Great place to relax when there's traffic on the way back from Vegas.

Had to add this business because it's not listed on yelp. I just wanted to say that after eating at Chillis in Barstow Ca, I am soo sick. We are there last night and i have been stuck on the toilet since we got home. I'm not sure if they didn't wash their hands properly or if the food was not stored correctly but either way I have food poisoning from this nasty place. Thanks Chiilis for charging me 45 bucks to make me sick as hell!

The service was Bad I would not go here again the Waitress was not Committed to what She was doing We did not Get drinks from her Another waitress took or order we had to stop other people to Get refills or other things She would drop food off food to others and Keep goinq I would not recommend this place It seems to not be able to handle a Small Crowd

Waited 15 minutes to get our server to come over and take our order at the table (mind you it was not super busy). Then after an additional 20 minutes we decided to walk since we didn't even get our waters or the one appetizer we ordered.

Terrible service, very dirty bathrooms. Worst Chili's I've ever been too,such a disappointment. I would think the restaurant employees would be on top of it because it's a busy location, but obviously not. If your on your way home ,don't stop here!

The waitress was nice but no compliments to the chef. I ordered cheese enchiladas when I sat down. Thirty minutes later they appearedvand they were soaked in the saltiest red sauce. I switched to the sour cream ones and it was soaked in clumpy white sauce and cold grated cheese in the middle. Those went back as well. Thirty minutes later my meal comes back. I boxed it up. I got full off of chips and salsa in the hour and a half I waited for my plate. And no they didn't even offer anything but an apology.

As a whole I'm disapointed with the brand. I don't like their menu changes - moving away from their casual Tex-Mex and going into a more trendy South-West. This has resulted in several menu casualties that my friends abd I enjoyed: RIP Buffalo Chicken Fajitas, Mushroom Burger, and Chicken Fried Steak. However, this review is based on this paticular restuarant. I gave it +1 for the service and a +1 for food taste; our server was friendly and attentive. He came a checked on us regularly which is rare for a Barstow joint. My group all got different burgers and they tasted acceptable, and all seemed to be going for a higher-end look but had an slightly better than average taste.  A reluctant +1 for cost: ranging from $9 to $12 for the burgers which is what you expect from casual dining digs for a ham-burgs - I'd still prefer to go to In-&-Out for my collin killing fix. However, I have to give a -1 for the mistake of basically giving us all the same burger: mine was a Sweet Smokehouse (or something like that) which came with Onion Rings, sauce, and cheese. Friend 1 got a Southern Smokehouse (not the same as mine) which was saposed to have bacon, cheese, and another kind of sauce. Friend 2 got a basic Cheeseburger with bacon. Instead, friend 1 got a cheeseburger with sauce and friend two got thr dame thing with bacon. Mine was fine. I know it sounds confusing but I read the descriptions of each item out of curiosity, and it matters because each burger had a different price so they all should have been unique. Our server comped us some onion rings to make friend 1's burger more Smokehousey so that worked.  It was busy which explains the mix-up, but professional cooks should still know the difference in their food. Overall, it was still a fun and good experience - and I will go back mainly because there are not many other places in Barstow.

we went to dinner at Chili's.  It was like an episode from Twilight Zone.  We were seated at 3:50pm.  The waiter came over at 4:05pm.  The lunch menu was over at 4:00pm .  We were not allowed to order from the lunch menu.  I wanted the  1/2 blt with salad.  The waiter said "Of course you can not have that, the order has to be in before 4pm:" I asked if I could pay extra money and still have it.  Of course you can not have that.  I showed him where the salad on the same page had you could pay $2 more and have it after 4pm.  Oh, the salads are not the lunch menu, of course you can have the salads.  If was very confusing.  I was going to have the prime rib tacos, but really wanted the blt and salad.  When it was all over and done, I asked if I could have blt and fries.  He said of course I could have blt and fries.  I could not located it on the menu.  He said of course it is not on the menu.  It seemed of course was his go to phrase.  I was concerned about the price, since it was not on the menu.  I said, I wanted the blt and fries, if it was not more than the prime rib tacos.  Later he came back and said it was $5 cheaper than the prime rib tacos.  I believe the prime rib tacos were $10 or $11.  It took forever.  It was at least an hour before we received our food.  Chili's must be for people who are "dining".  I asked for a to go container.  One would think that would be the hint we wanted the ticket.  We waited and waited for the ticket.  We never did see that.  I had a gift card for Chili's, I had no idea how much was left on it.  I gave the waiter the gift card and my credit card.  He brought back just the credit card.  I asked him how much was on the gift card, he oh it was like $4 or something.  I think I was charged $11.25 on my credit card, but I'm not real sure.  I got 3 different charge receipts.  One was for $6.25. One for $4.00 and One for $11.25.  By this point we just wanted to leave.  We were so over it.  We will not be returning to Chili's again.  It was a very ambiguous conversation at best.

Great bar but they like to add on the ice and take too much from the drink.  Normal food for the bar and as one Yelper said, it is quite salty.  There are not many choices in Barstow that has this atmosphere so it became a normal hang out for me and my crew.  It was just ok.  Always had to order an extra shot for my drinks as they seemed either too much mix or too much ice.  Loved the fact that you could pay at the table and it also calculated the tip based on percentages that the patron chooses.  The service is always bar none and we could count on refills and hot food.  Parking can get hectic but just go behind the restaurant on the other side.  Go for the drinks, stay for the camaraderie.

This place was a joke. Our hotel was right in front of this venue and me, being the lazy-ass I am, decided to just eat here (my biggest sin: knowing that Chipotle was a 5 minute drive). While the interior is surprisingly clean and somewhat accommodating, the food was overpriced, over-salted, and barely edible. The choose-2-for-$16.95 is a complete waste of money - the portions of the meats are so stingy. Avoid here like a plague, even if it's close to the hotel. There's In N Out & Chipotle nearby. I warned you.

worst dining experience  ever..but then again its barstow. 10 mins to get seated and 50 mins to get food.  waitress was great but food sucked.and we ordered salads and burgers. the ampm/arco station probably has better food. hands down!!
I like chills a lot it's really good ... Just wish they still had there Jalapeno onion things

Tired of POOR customer service at this location. Management doesn't understand how to keep customers.  Too bad. They final straw was not being able to take a coupon that was sent to my email. Didn't realize it was for dine-in only and I ordered take-out. Manager said this is company policy and couldn't over-ride it.  Couldn't ring it out differently. Was adamant about this policy. I thought keeping the customer satisfied and coming back would be much more important than policy. Oh well. Their loss.

Service here was legit terrible. We stood around waiting for the host/ess to seat us for a solid 5 minute. Nobody seemed interested in us. So, against my better judgement, we just picked a spot and sat down. Our server wasn't much more attentive than the non-existent hostess. Despite all of this, the food was standard Chili's fare, which is acceptable at best. But it hit the spot on our way to Vegas. Next time I'm passing through, I'll stop somewhere else.

Super thirsty and craving something "southwestern" and not fast food, I was so happy to find this Chili's on our way back to SoCal area. I was even happier to find the restaurant super clean and friendly. We ordered the Triple dipper appetizer--finally got to try fried pickles:)  My Santa Fe Salad was so good I practically licked the plate (seriously, pathetic hipster haters, the food is good--just close your eyes and pretend you got it off a food truck).  But the best was the service.  Melissa was our server and was awesome from the start. Really made me feel at home in a town I live like 2~3 hours away from where I live.  There was another server (sorry I wish I caught her name) who passed by and made sure we had refills on our sodas and enough napkins (guess I'm a messy eater), even though it wasn't even her table. I give 5 stars because I know I will be traveling through Barstow in the future-after all it's on the way to Las Vegas as well as so many other destinations (I have passed through here on the way to/from Las Vegas, Fresno, Arizona, etc. many times this year.)  5 stars for service and food quality, and for giving me my go-to place in Barstow. I WILL be back.

Stopped here after a long day of driving!  Was so happy it was here as all of the other restaurants are fast food.  We both had the fajitas they were hot and fresh.  The service could have been faster but otherwise we had a nice end to our long day!

(9/1/2014)If I could give ZERO stars for ZERO service,  I would.   35 minutes from the time we walked in until we walked out.  Drinks never arrived (water).  Where did the staff go?  I guess there is no need to speculate,  they were just gone.  I yelled out to the bar tender as our party of 4 left the place to let him know we were leaving.  No one gave a shit.

I give two stars since the ordering online process was easy, when I called in they were friendly and helpful. I'd give it no stars for food. I ordered chicken fajitas. The food was not hot nor even warm. Chicken looked like a grilled chicken breast cooked, chilled, sliced, and placed on a salad. Peppers were raw tossed in seasoning and oil. Onions were grilled and chilled. The corn tortillas were what they use for hard tacos. Too thick and starchy.  Worst fajitas of my life. Literally. Wow!

First off, they got our drink order wrong, we got regular coke when we requested diet. After about 10 - 15 minutes we finally saw our server and got the correct drinks. Then we waited, and waited, and waited some more. Finally a manager checked on us and we asked about our order. Amazingly right after that the order showed up. But, yes there is a but (or two), the food was not hot, and my friend's order was wrong. They did manage to bring the correct order fairly quickly, and, yes, it was hot! We finished the meal, and waited again, this time for the check. Not the speediest Chili's. If you are traveling along the I 15 and want a quick meal, don't stop at Chili's in Barstow. In fact, don't stop even you aren't in a hurry.

It's a Chili's. Chain restaurant in the middle of nowhere. Passable when you are hungry and Victorville is just a tad too far to wait to eat. (Southbound). Grab a cheeseburger and fries. You are probably still hungover so it really doesn't matter. Place is clean and the servers are pleasant.

Seriously. How could they get so few stars? It's chilli's. The place is packed. It's an hour wait and not less than 50% of the tables are sitting empty or unbussed. Epic fail. Their corp office should send someone decent to fix their efficiency
Service stunk!.  And when I walked out I mentioned it to the two girls up front. They looked at me like I spoke to them in Chinese!   Food was good! Worse chili's I have ever been to!
Probably the worst Chilies I've ever been to. My ice tea tasted like nothing. My fries were cold and stale, my sandwich was wet as well.

Only the food was good and that was not up to the Chili's standard, the service was slow, both the wait staff and the meal service.  Would I stop there again? NO WAY. And we eat at Chili's at home all the time, just NOT THIS ONE
Came only a few people and the service still is bad. Cold outside why does it have to be cold inside. Food is good if you don't mind waiting on slow staff.
NO! Worst chili's I have ever been to. Slow service, bad food.

Service here usually isn't the best but tonight the service was excellent. Shamia took great care of us; she took our order quickly, came to check on us, refilled out drinks and brought the check in a timely manner. I appreciate her service and I hope we can get her as our waitress again. Thanks, Shamia!

I didn't realize how delicious Chillis was until I ate here! The chicken enchilada soup is yummy. Darlene was our server and she was sweet fun and nice. Great time. Oh and don't forget to grab a margarita.

Worst chilis experience I've ever had. Waited over an hour to get our food. People who sat down 30 minutes after us got their food before. Finally get our food and it's cold. Glasses were dirty. Not a great vibe or experience at all!

It's a Chili's so I wasn't expecting much as food goes but so I'm mostly grading this on service. It sucked. Took forever for everything and the place wasn't even busy and my food came out cold which means are server was to busy to just grab the shit. Hopefully they will build an Applebee's out here one day so this place has some competition and stop acting like their shit don't stink. It will be awhile before I roll back into this place again and if I do I will just stick to happy hour at the bar and leave the food alone.

Quite possibly the worst service and food I've ever experienced. Waited over an hour while we were told 20 times good was coming. When it did it was disgusting. You're much better off going to In-n-Out or El Pollo Loco in Lenwood.

On our way back from a Vegas bachelor party we planned the requisite stop at In-N-Out Barstow. Becuase In-N-Out is delicious and because that's what you do on your way back from Vegas. In fact, I made my buddy the bachelor -- who was starving -- wait till Barstow to eat. "Dude, relax, your Double-Double will be that much more delicious." In-N-Out was closed that Sunday (Easter Sunday). Oops, my bad. But then my buddy had what seemed like a brilliant idea: what about the Chili's across the street. For the win. Chili's is one of the better chain restaurants. What could go wrong? Answer: the spinach dip (bland and cold). The service (also bland and cold).  My rum-and-pineapple (bland and warm). This is not your typical Chili's. In this case, that's a bad thing.

We eat here often and it's always been pleasant. We have never been disappointed at the service, and we order our usual favorites so there's no complaint there either. Maybe other people just don't know what to order ;)

It's a Chili's, and they all pretty much strive to be alike. In that respect, this place succeeds. The staff are quite friendly though! I've eaten here many times while in town for work, and I've never had a mishap with my order. They're also great for those on business because they have no problem splitting the bill any way you need. Honestly, I try to avoid such restaurants... but this is Barstow, and I can't say that many of the local offerings are better. So, if you're stuck here (like I am) it's probably your best bet for decent food and good service.
Great food the steak was so tender.  Customer service was awesome! Definitely coming back

One would think going to a 'Chain' restaurant is a safe bet.  You'd expect the food to be consistent or at least somewhat close.  NOT HERE!!!!   I've always liked Chili's.  No, they don't have the finest food on earth, but they do have a few dishes I like.  When I just don't feel like driving more than 10 minutes to go somewhere or eating fast food, I can go to Chili's and have a descent meal.   On our way back from Vegas, I just didn't want to have tacos, burgers, or chicken at Barstow again, so I told my fiance to stop at Chili's.  When we walked in, we were greeted and led to a booth which still had crumbs all over the seats.  The host quickly grabbed a wet towel to wipe them.  One would think he could have just seated us at another booth because the restaurant was pretty empty.  He dropped the menu and left.  I had to grab some napkins from another table to wipe the seats again b/c they were too wet to sit. When we sat down and put our hands on the table, we got ketchup on our arms!  What was wrong with these people?  They weren't even busy and they couldn't even clean the table/seats right?  Then the host brought over a couple of forks wrapped in napkins.  He said, sorry, we only have forks.  The waiter later explained that the kitchen couldn't clean the knife fast enough.  WTF?  Next to my food.  I ordered 1/2 rack of baby back ribs thinking I've had this many times before at the Chili's near my house and they have always been pretty good.  But when I took a bite, they were cold!!!  My guess is that they ribs were 'pre-cooked' and when someone orders it, they just put on some BBQ sauce and pop them in the microwave oven to heat.  And they couldn't even heat them hot!!!!  I ended up eating only 2 pieces (of the 6 pieces).  This was the WORST baby back ribs I've ever had in my whole life!!!   Unfortunately I also had to make a stop at the rest room and it was messy as hell.  Paper towel everywhere on the floor.  Com'on!  Even Del Taco's restroom is cleaner than yours!   I thought Bob's Big Boy was bad!  Chili's was worse!!!  If you must stop to refuel at Barstow, stick with fast food.  I've learned my lessons now.
The last few times eating here the service was bad.  The waiters and waitresses just walked by us for 10 to 15 minutes.  We just sat there with our menus and no drinks.

The service is cool. My boyfriend and I have been stopping here because behind the restaurant is a charging station for Tesla's. While we wait for our car to charge we usually will sit at the bar and grab dinner. The food is your typical bland chain style quality.

Worst Chilis location EVER!! We waited 35 minutes for our appetizers to come out!! Then another 30 minutes after that for our entrees!! To top it off some of the entrees came out barely warm. The waitress never once apologized or explained why! We saw other tables get sat, get their food, eat and leave before we even got our food!! Ridiculous!! Finally we were so irritated we found the manager to see if she was aware and if there was some explanation. All she says is sorry, would a free dessert make it any better? Now why would we wanna sit and wait again for the dessert to come out?! But not trying to be difficult, we said that was fine. I just couldn't believe that was the best they could do! I thought all chilis were created equal but obviously I was wrong!

I recently moved to the high desert from central Texas and this being the closest sit down non-fast food type restaurant to ft Irwin I went in not expecting a lot, and left surprised. This was probably the best Chilis meal I have ever had. I had a new fajita dish and I actually ate the whole thing which is not like me...I never finish a meal in a restaurant...even my husband thoroughly enjoyed his steak quesadilla...good job Chilis! We will be back for sure!
Typical Chili's - food average to good. Service good. Right across the street from out hotel! Extra points.

apparently chili's is the nicest restaurant in town. i'm not one for chains, especially on vacation, but it was either this or the sizzler. we decided not to risk it.  and whaddiya know, it was a great dining experience! we did the $20 for an appetizer and 2 entrees, which is a ridiculously good deal for the amount and quality of food we got. our eyes being ever larger than our stomachs, we also ordered a salad.  appetizers:  the corn in the guac added some flavor you don't usually get. a nice twist on a simple dish that i eat often. the salsa was pureed- not really my thing, but it was good. the chips were greasy n kinda gross. we ate our leftover dips the next day with some wavy lays we had in the car. cobb salad: a breath of fresh air after all the junk we'd been eating. mmmm...i want one now! entrees: the ribs were just ok. with a jingle so catchy people still sing it a decade later, this should totally be their best dish. shame on them. the grilled scrimp tacos on the other hand were spicy and delectible. i actually ate a leftover taco for breakfast. for breakfast! this from a girl who won't eat anything but breakfast food as the first meal of the day, even if she doesn't get up until 3 pm.  drinks: we each tried a margarita- she a "freshest," and me a pomegranate. not bad, but a tad overpriced. service: can't complain. friendly, quick but not rushed, and correct. so the moral of the story is, don't bring a date to barstow. but if you must dine out while you're there, chili's is where it's at.

ended up sitting in the bar area at a table, got seated faster, not many people in there, food was good, waitress was friendly, but forgetful, would go get something and never come back, ask again and she would go oh i'm sorry and take off to get it again. so very slow service, liked the one in victorville better
not bad,,,good place to make a pit stop and have a good meal

Bottom line:  Chili's would normally get a 2-star from me in civilization, but in Barstow this is about as good as it gets. Specifics: if you are starving, even an MRE tastes pretty good.  If you have to be in Barstow, Chili's seems like fine dining.  Their fajitas are actually quite good, they have a full bar, and the service is very friendly.  There are conveniently located near some new motels such as the renovated Hampton Inn.  Seeing as how work takes me to the NTC and Barstow periodically, Chili's is a welcome sight.

Friendly service, though slow. Food was just OK - the veggie burgers were dry; so were the buns which kind of looked like they came from McDonald's. My wife LOVES onion rings but was not excited by these at all; even they looked dried out.
The food is typical Chili's but everytime I have been there the service is sooooooo slow! Good if you got some time to wait.

Mediocre...food is sometimes good, but the majority of the time it is either wrong, cold or accompanied by plastic bags or something else the cooks forgot to remove from the pre-made food before serving. Granted they did give us 50$ worth of gift certificates after that little stunt. Its a 50/50 chance you take at this place. Sometimes its good, sometimes it's horrible. It stinks because the options for resteraunts in this town blows. So if you do try it..be prepared for the worst and hope for the best! Lol
Food wasn't fresh.  Ordered salad and lettuce was yellow, avocado brown and chicken burnt.  Service was slow and unpleasant.  Go someplace else to eat if possible.

An ok visit here today, not one of the best by far but Kathy(manager) was very apologetic and made sure we were taken care of. I understand Holiday weekend is always tough for restaurants. Food was good but took a long time to arrive, considering we ordered 3 salads and fajitas. We were offered chips & salsa while we continued to wait. I had to settle for fajitas as they had ran out of their baby back ribs! Anyway. Probably would have been. 1 star review but it wasn't like we were ignored, it wasn't like mgmt or staff weren't aware of the issues and we were compensated for it. They were also helpful in helping my wife choose a vegetarian option and with that they picked up 2 stars.

Service is ridiculous!!!  Walked in and there was no host in the front to seat us so we just stood around for a good 10 mins. (It wasn't busy or anything either). They finally sat us but to a dirty table. The place is basically empty so why the dirty table?  After she cleaned the tables, she placed our menus on the completely wet table and expected us to pick it up. Yuck! Server didn't show up for another 15 mins to even take our drinks. She was about to leave but I had to stop her from dashing off and told her we're also ready to order. Appetizers came out and we didn't get any little plates to eat with. Our food was soo salty!  Like chill with the salt shaker people.  Salty food with moody lackluster service. No thank you Chilis! Oh and all the workers were basically hiding out in the kitchen the whole entire time.

My husband and I came here on a Monday night since it was one of the few restaurants in Barstow open on a Monday for dinner. There was no wait to get seated. The prices are the same as in Virginia so we were happy with that. The food was also very good but most chili's I've been to have been consistently good. We got our food in about 25mins which is the same back home. All the waiters were friendly and checked on us often. Honestly I don't know why there are so many bad revives of the place. Definitely would come back again!

This place was on the top of the list of worst places to eat.  It took 20 minutes for us to get sat which is understandable since this is one of the few places to sit and eat with your family while passing through Barstow.  Once we got seated, it took almost 25 minutes before anyone even came to talk to us.  Our order was taken and then it took 32 minutes before food showed up.  I totally understand being busy, but this place takes the cake.  Every item on our order came out wrong, the waitress gave us attitude on the fact that our order was wrong, and didn't seem to care at all.  She then yelled at me for not using the desktop device to place our order.  I cracked up and asked "how are we supposed to know about the device if no one tells us?"..  This place is horrible and shouldn't be in business with the service and attitude that we got.
Our server Dawn was lovely but everything logistically went wrong and we waited an hour and ended up leaving without eating. Won't come back here again.
We do chilis all the time and we love it . lately though service is very slow. Very few servers .. I think we will give them time to get it together. Also food not so good

Food all tastes the same...nothing stands out...a good server is pretty much a toss up. One time I was sitting at a table in the bar area with a friend...some older woman was a greeter of some sort because she acknowledged EVERYONE but my friend n I Another time I went with another friend and sat in the dinning area...our server was a,Mexican woman named Cindy...she was awesome...nice..curteous...very attentive to the customers...and that's not the first time shes been our server. Food is still nothing to brag about.  I recommend Peggy Sues or if u have to be nearby...then Dennys...their sandwiches are ALWAYS good

This place has 2.5 stars cause that's exactly what you get. It's not a 3 star but not 2 either.  I've been here two times and had the exact same experience. Both times the service was friendly enough and the food was good enough, but some of the basics are missed - or rather ignored.   - tables around us on both occasions sat dirty for the ENTIRE time, while servers chatted idly in the side stations.  - food took eons to come out... Like +30 minutes.  - when food arrived, we didn't get all of the order correctly.  - the handy-dandy table electronic menu, while enticing you to order more and conveniently allowing you to reorder second beverages without having to flag down a server, definitely contribute to an apathetic, lazy service staff that doesn't talk about or upsell the menu at all. In fact, they seem to care less about you enjoying your experience than before.

Worst service I've ever had... I waited 45 minutes on a beer! Yes a beer! Charlene the waitress my seem nice but she could careless about her customers.... I've never been this mad before... for the food to be so good and service shitty it's just a shame.

This is one of the worst places to eat when expecting good customer service. Food was extremely late from the time we ordered it plus they got plenty of orders incorrect. We were a large party celebrating a great occasion which was overshadowed by customer service that proved to be subpar.

I've gone to Chili's for years now, and I like their food. But the service today here was disappointing. Put in a to go order, they told me it would be ready in 10 minutes. I gave them 15 minutes. Get there and no one is at the to go desk. We ring the bell as instructed. We continue to wait, and wait. There were several employees there who passed us. The bartender looked right at us. I was appalled, we waited there 10 minutes. I was about to ring the bell again, when someone finally came up and asked if we had been helped! I said no, and we have been here a while. My daughter and I then had to wait another 10 minutes for our food! I will not be going back to this Chili's location, poor customer service.

I was presently surprised! I came with my family of 5 on a Friday night, we were seated immediately and our drink order was taken. The waitress was knowledgeable regarding the New menu items and had a wonderful personality. We have never been a huge fan of the old menu, so we were excited about the New choices. Our food was awesome. My husband had the steak fajitas and I had the honey chipoltle chicken tacos. Both entrees were delicious. The beans that came with my tacos we're some of the best I have ever had. The kids had kids meals and we were all full and happy. The Bill was around 60 dollars, which didn't hurt either. We will definently  Be stopping to have dinner again soon!

On of the worst service that I seen I waited 30 +Mts to be seated another 20 Mts till someone finally came to take the order and the best part is they got at least 5 6 empty tables to make it short 1 star

Ordered their guacamole; was made by the server. Too salty!! Ordered their ribeye steak; too greasy. Too much butter!! When the food was brought to the table, I asked for the steak sauce. Half way through my steak, still hasn't got one. Few min later, I got napkins first, then the steak sauce. Never asked for any refills or drinks after food was served.  As we were about to leave , we over heard another customer complaining and wanting to cancel their order because they were waiting for long...

We were here a few years ago and had the worst experience ever! The place was almost empty but it still took forever for our server to come take our order. Our food took really long to come out. The food was cold, hard, and tasted like last week's reheated dinner. The service was horrible, we never had anybody come back to check on us or refill our drinks. We vowed never to come back to this location! Fast forward about 5-7 yrs later and we're in the area again but don't want fast food. We decided to give them another chance and see if they could redeem themselves. This time the place was full but we got seated right away which seemed like a good sign already. We sit down and the hostess tells us the names of our 2 servers. We continue to sit and wait for either of these 2 people to show but nothing. Servers keep passing us and looking at our table but none of them stopped. Finally one of the guys that had looked in our direction multiple times already stopped and asked if anyone had helped us yet. We put in our drink and appetizer order in and waited some more. Once our drinks and appetizer came out he put them down and scurried off before we could ask for anything. No plates, no napkins, nothing to eat our appetizer with properly. When our food came out everything looked old and dry. My enchilada was hard and stale, to a point where I couldn't even cut it. My beans seemed to have a dried out layer like it had been sitting under the heat lamp for awhile. My kids' side of celery had brown spots all over them. Their cheeseburgers had no cheese. We asked for an extra plate so they could share but no one ever came back. Except for the times when our food and drinks were brought out, we never saw a server. We never got checked on, we had to flag someone down to get a drink refill and we never found out who this second mystery server was either. So it's safe to say that after this time, we're REALLY are not coming back!

Three for late lunch; onion ring app was prompt, hot, and crispy, drinks and beer refills timely, waited longer than average for food, but we were kept updated about the progress. Before the end of the meal a manager stopped by to see how everything was.  For the area, this location is at least my plan B. You can count on reliable service and quality for reasonable prices here.

We visited this same Chili's on Labor Day weekend, 2 years after our last visit. Much to our surprise we were very happy with our food and the service. The waitress we had was only on her 2nd day on the job but she gave us fantastic service and management stopped by our table twice to see how we were doing. Thank you Chili's for the much improved service and tasty meal.

Chili's is Chili's, it is what it is, nothing really to write home about, and its your average bar and grill food. I'm giving this place 5 stars due to the service here. I was stuck in Barstow for about 13 weeks due to work, and I ate here about 3 times a week. The food was not the reason why we came here so much, but it was the service that Pat gave us every night. Being away from home so much kind of sucks, and having Pat as our server every night was amazing. She treated us like family, and was full of positive energy that after a bad day at work she made us forget all about it, and helped us end our day in a positive note. Thank you Pat for making our day every night while in Barstow.

We weren't in the door 10 mins and we had 5 different servers which in turn had everything messed.  You go into a restaurant and they advertise "Happy Hour Friday 4pm-7pm" and you sit down look at the beer list and Happy Hour prices are a dollar cheaper. (Dollar is a dollar lol) Well you order your beer and you get curious if they charged you correctly for said beer so you look at their table Kiosk at your bill. Nope charged you regular price, no big you ask the waitress about it and she looks at you and says "No that's not for you or anyone that sits on this side of the restaurant you HAVE to sit in the "bar only" area and she walks away.  So I sit and think and think and if you know me...I get pissed and called her back and ask why and it was the most ridiculous thing I've ever heard. She just stares at me because I'm getting madder with every word.  I feel as though because I brought my family there I was being punished by paying full price, like my family and I were secondary to the "bar only area"  Yea I will NOT be going back...and Im a local!  Most ridiculous thing I've ever heard. Yes I filled out a survey and I'll put it on Yelp as well.  Please know the dollar wasn't a big deal it was the point that because I'm having a beer at the dining table with my family I wasn't worth giving "Happy Hour" prices too.

This Chili's location always has excellent food and service. My family enjoys using the rewards as well as taking advantage of the emails that offer special food and drink pairings and great prices. We especially enjoy the triple dipper and tableside guacamole appetizers, and we are impressed with recent additions to the menu  such as the new taco selections.
